name: TV Characters Test | Name The Show

questions.text: Governor James Gatling, Gretchen Kraus, Katie Gatling
questions.explanation:
"Benson".

	This spin-off of "Soap" had Benson now working for the Governor.  Robert Guillaume starred as Benson in this sitcom that ran from 1979-1986.

questions.text: Peter Thornton, Harry Jackson, Penny Parker
questions.explanation:
"MacGyver".

	In this drama, former Special Forces agent Angus MacGyver (Richard Dean Anderson) found himself  keeping the world safe by working for a secret agency called The Phoenix Foundation.  This show aired for 1985-1992.

Seinfeld.

	"Seinfeld"  was voted the top TV series of all time by TV Guide editors in 2002.   This show about 'nothing' aired from 1990-1998.

questions.text: Roger Addison,  Carol Post, Winnie Kirkwood
questions.explanation:
"Mr. Ed"

	The voice of Mr. Ed was provided by the multi-talented Alan "Rocky" Lane.  This sitcom was one of the few TV series to start in syndication, then, be picked up by a major network. It aired from 1961-1966.

questions.text: Officer Doug Penhall, Officer Tom Hanson, Captain Adam Fuller
questions.explanation:
"21 Jump Street".

	Cops go undercover as high school students in this drama.  Johnny Depp played Officer Hanson.   "21 Jump Street" was one of the FOX networks big hits.  It ran from 1987-1990 and then in syndication until 1991.

questions.text: Dr. Sam Beckett, Rear Admiral Calavicci
questions.explanation:
"Quantum Leap".

	This sci-fi/fantasy TV show starred Scott Bakula (Beckett) and Dean Stockwell (Calavicci).  Providing the voice of "Ziggy", the computer was Deborah Pratt.  This show aired from 1989-1993.

questions.text: Mrs. Trumbull, Caroline Appleby, Betty Ramsey
questions.explanation:
I Love Lucy.

	"I Love Lucy" started out as a successful radio program called "My Favorite Husband".  It first aired on TV in 1951 and aired until 1957.  It returned back on the air from 1957-1960 as "The Lucy- Desi Comedy Hour".

questions.text: Josephine Potter, Jennifer Lindley, Pacey Witter
questions.explanation:
"Dawson's Creek".

	This teen drama focuses on the lives of four teenagers in Capeside, Massachusetts. It has been on the air since 1998 and stars James Van Der Beek, Katie Holmes, Michelle Williams and Joshua Jackson.

questions.text: Howard Borden, Carol Kester Bondurant, Elliot Carlin
questions.explanation:
"The Bob Newhart Show".

	Bob Newhart starred as psychologist Bob Hartley in this sitcom that aired from 1972-1978.  Also co-starring was Susanne Pleshette, Bill Daily, Peter Bonerz and Marcia Wallace.

questions.text: Dr. Jack Morrison, Dr. Mark Craig, Dr. Donald Westphall
questions.explanation:
"St. Elsewhere"

	This medical drama takes place at St. Eligius Hospital (aka St. Elsewhere) in Boston.  This show aired from 1982-1988 and was the forerunner of other medical dramas such as "ER" and "Chicago Hope".
